tool.name: epiGeEC Evaluate Clustering
tool.command: geec_ari.py #if $ignore_user.do_ignore_user: -i #end if "${matrix}"" "${public_metadata}" #if str( $clusteringAlgoCond.algo ) == "hierarchical": --linkage "${clusteringAlgoCond.linkage}" #end if --title epiGeEC\ Evaluate\ Clustering\ of\ ${public_metadata.name} #if str($breakdowns) != "": -b ${breakdowns} #end if #if str($restrictions) != "": -r ${restrictions} #end if > ${output}

param.name: matrix
param.label: Matrix file
param.help: Select a matrix coming from "epiGeEC Correlation Matrix".

param.name: public_metadata
param.label: Public metadata file
param.help: Select a JSON file containing public dataset IDs and their metadata, coming from the "epiGeEC Public Dataset Selection" selection tool.

param.name: algo
param.label: Clustering Algorithm
param.help: Select which algorithm to use for the clustering.

param.name: linkage
param.label: Linkage Method
param.help: Select which linkage method to use for the hierarchical clustering.

param.name: restrictions
param.label: Category restriction
param.help: Restrict the annotation to some categories of metadata label by typing the category name as written in the metadata file, seperated by a blank (e.g. assay publishing_group cell_type).

param.name: breakdowns
param.label: Breakdown the annotation of some categories of metadata label.
param.help: Type the category name as written in the metadata file, seperated by a blank (e.g. assay publishing_group).

tool.help:
**What it does**
epiGeEC Evaluate Clustering takes as input approximately the same parameters as epiGeEC Annotate Matrix to calculate the Adjusted Rand Index (ARI, values between ~0 and 1) providing a quantitative evaluation of the clustering performed by epiGeEC Annotate Matrix (in other words how well the clustering corresponds to the expected structure based on the metadata). It is particularly useful to compare different sets of paramaters.
The output of epiGeEC Evaluate Clustering is a tsv containing two tables. The first contains the ARI values for each selected label category as column, and optionally a breakdown of some label categories (e.g. the breakdown of the « assay » label category will calculate ARI values individually for RNA-seq, H3K4me3, …). The second table contains the number of different labels for each category.
